results.definition: financial resources provided to make some project possible
examples: the foundation provided support for the experiment

results.definition: argue or speak in defense of
examples: She supported the motion to strike

results.definition: put up with something or somebody unpleasant
a military operation (often involving new supplies of men and materiel) to strengthen a military force or aid in the performance of its mission
examples: they called for artillery support

results.definition: be the physical support of; carry the weight of
examples: He supported me with one hand while I balanced on the beam

results.definition: adopt as a belief
the financial means whereby one lives
examples: he applied to the state for support

results.definition: a musical part (vocal or instrumental) that supports or provides background for other musical parts
the act of bearing the weight of or strengthening
examples: he leaned against the wall for support

results.definition: be a regular customer or client of
documentary validation
examples: the strongest support for this view is the work of Jones

results.definition: establish or strengthen as with new evidence or facts
examples: The evidence supports the defendant

results.definition: be behind; approve of
support with evidence or authority or make more certain or confirm
give moral or psychological support, aid, or courage to
examples: She supported him during the illness

results.definition: aiding the cause or policy or interests of
examples: the president no longer has the support of his own party
they developed a scheme of mutual support

results.definition: any device that bears the weight of another thing
examples: there was no place to attach supports for a shelf

results.definition: play a subordinate role to (another performer)
examples: Olivier supported Gielgud beautifully in the second act

results.definition: something providing immaterial assistance to a person or cause or interest
examples: the policy found little public support
his faith was all the support he needed
the team enjoyed the support of their fans

results.definition: supporting structure that holds up or provides a foundation
examples: the statue stood on a marble support

results.definition: support materially or financially
examples: he does not support his natural children
The scholarship supported me when I was in college

results.definition: the activity of providing for or maintaining by supplying with money or necessities
examples: his support kept the family together
they gave him emotional support during difficult times
